page.title: 16Gawcott <1>
page.content: Gawcott is situated two miles south west of Buckingham.It is a medium size village and has a mixture of old and new houses. One of the oldest,{Manor {Farm, }dates back to {1677}and is in Hillesden Road. The oldest houses are {thatched}and new ones are tiled. The brickwork is irregular because varying brick sizes were used. In Main Street , Old Bakery House , which was{built around 1796.}It was originally three cottages ; one of which was a sweet shop the other a bakery. When it was renovated it was found to contain made of {wattle and {daub.}In the yard there is a grain store and a well. At the western end of Church Street there is a Church which is a late {Georgian } building, consecrated in 1807. It has{clear glass}windows and the ceiling is flat not vaulted.
